meanings.definition: To remove someone from one's list of friends on a social networking website.
meanings.sent1: I had to defriend a person who was being mean online.
meanings.sent2: She decided to defriend her ex-boyfriend after their breakup.
meanings.sent3: When my friend kept posting embarrassing photos, I had to defriend them.
meanings.sent4: In the virtual world, it's easy to defriend someone with just a click.
meanings.sent5: To avoid drama, she chose to defriend the troublemaker.

meanings.definition: To end a friendship with someone.
meanings.sent1: He had to defriend his friend who was always causing trouble.
meanings.sent2: After the argument, she made the tough decision to defriend her longtime pal.
meanings.sent3: When his buddy kept borrowing money without returning it, he had to defriend him.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes it's necessary to defriend toxic people for your own well-being.
meanings.sent5: She realized it was time to defriend her childhood friend who had changed for the worse.
